DOC.brief_summary: This double-blinded placebo-controlled non-inferiority study examine incidence significance contrast-induced acute kidney injury follow intravenous iodinate contrast material administration subject stage IIIB stage IV chronic kidney disease . Subjects schedule clinically indicate CT abdomen and/or pelvis evaluate suspect intra-abdominal infection . Subjects randomize receive either weight-based low-osmolality iodinate contrast material saline . The primary outcome measure incidence stage II AKI AKIN criterion .
DOC.detailed_description: This double-blinded placebo-controlled non-inferiority study examine incidence significance contrast-induced acute kidney injury follow intravenous iodinate contrast material administration subject stage IIIB stage IV chronic kidney disease . Subjects schedule clinically indicate CT abdomen and/or pelvis evaluate suspect intra-abdominal infection . Subjects randomize receive either weight-based low-osmolality iodinate contrast material saline . The primary outcome measure incidence stage II AKI AKIN criterion . Secondary outcome measure include AKI definition ( stage I AKI , traditional CI-AKI definition ) , hospital length stay , 30-day readmission rate , number additional percutaneous intervention within 30 day , number additional CT examination within 30 day , 30-day mortality rate . All subject receive minimum 1 mL/kg/hr ( max : 125 mL/hr ) volume expansion least three hour pre three hour post-CT .
DOC.criteria: Inpatients schedule CT scan abdomen and/or pelvis Have surgery last 4 week Stable renal function ( base serum creatininelast two lab value +/ 0.3 , recent within 5 day CT ) Suspected infection fluid collection abdomen and/or pelvis Pregnant Severe Allergy ( anaphylaxis ) contrast Dialysis last 7 day Received intravascular iodinate contrast last 48 hour CT abdomen pelvis last 7 day show fluid collection Prisoners CT order indication necessitates ( eg , CT angiogram ) contraindicate ( eg , renal stone CT ) intravascular contrast
DOC.keyword: CT , iodinate contrast , contrast-induced AKI , kidney injury
